H0.text: Photosynthesis is the process during which cells use oxygen to release stored energy.

H1.text: Respiration is the process during which cells use oxygen to release stored energy.

H2.text: Circulation is the process during which cells use oxygen to release stored energy.

H3.text: Digestion is the process during which cells use oxygen to release stored energy.

A4.text: Cellular respiration is the process of oxidizing biological fuels using an inorganic electron acceptor, such as oxygen, to drive production of adenosine triphosphate (ATP)

A5.text: Anaerobic respiration uses inorganic molecules other than oxygen as final electron acceptors

A6.text: Aerobic respiration requires oxygen (O2) in order to create ATP

A7.text: The most common oxidizing agent is molecular oxygen (O2)
